data.text: Do You Use Loctite or another Thread Locker?
Do you guys use Loctite or another thread locker? I wonder what works well for bikes.
I just check my bolts regularly.
data.author: Martin Malloy

data.text: I have done for a threadless bb, I used the red, although should probably have used blue. I was not planning on removing it, ever. It worked.
data.author: Alan Reeve

data.text: Loctite blue on rack nuts.
data.author: Greg Hum

data.text: Yeah, I do this too. Don't think I'd want Loctite on anything else on my bike...
data.author: Dave Henderson

data.text: I would not use Loctite on any bike components but to each their own.
data.author: Jake Klamerus

data.text: Copperslip on all threaded assemblies.
data.author: Nick Perkins

data.text: I use both, blue is always my first choice and on any items where that doesn't do it, I use red unless there's some reason not to. And red lock tight can be removed using a heat gun as I understand it but I haven't had to do that yet. A strong preference for blue first.
data.author: James Mcginley

data.text: Yep, the blue stuff.
data.author: Pilecki Dave

data.text: I use Loctite blue thread locker.
data.author: Mark Perry

data.text: I wouldn't use anything stronger than blue Loctite on a bike...no need for red, and if there IS, you have worse problems than Loctite will fix. That said, I honestly can't think of anything on a bike that would need blue Loctite, except maybe disc rotor screws.
data.author: David Green

data.text: Yes I have it with me on the road at all times
data.author: Stephen Lawson

data.text: Rack nuts get blue, nothing anywhere else.
data.author: Terry L. Manuel

data.text: Yup blue for things like the traction pins on my flat pedals when I adjust them have to re-apply the bolts for racks etc with red
data.author: Menno Pieters

data.text: Yes, there are other companies making thread lock compounds, than Permatex-Loctite ... Red, is for press fit bearings that fit looser than you want.
data.author: Robert Clark

data.text: Blue Loctite on brake calliper screws, disk rotor screws, rack screws and bottle cage screws especially when using Stainless steel screws. ( it helps prevent thread pickup/growling) Have you ever seen brand new screws supplied with disk rotors etc with a blue stripe around the thread? this is a pre-applied thread locking compound so even manufacturers recommend it.
data.author: Craig Pullen

data.text: Blue loctite every time, or things come undone.
data.author: Raymond Stevens

data.text: It depends on which Parts and which thread locker. Maybe blue for crank bolts/cassette nut. in my workshop we use 4-5 different green, red, blue, white/crÃ¨me from Loctite and blue, green from Wurth,
data.author: Willem Vierbergen

data.text: Thank you all! I thought blue Loctite was the answer ðŸ˜Š My fenders always come loose and I have lost some screws on my pedals. I need to put an end to this.
data.author: Kostadin Mladenov

data.text: The trouble is metric threads are loose fit compared to the old days of the 60s and earlier when threads were AF or BSF since then if I change my bikes first thing I do is sort out what could and will work loose and add Loctite.
data.author: Raymond Stevens

data.text: You might want to try nylon bolts and hex nuts. However, I am surprised that Loctite blue didn't work for you. I have used it for years with no problems. I'm curious how you attach your fenders.
data.author: Peter Martinez

data.text: Oh no no, I havenâ€™t used Loctite yet, I just heard thatâ€™s what people use mostâ€”going to try it.
data.author: Kostadin Mladenov

data.text: Good to hear, I use lock nuts too on some spots. Good luck.
data.author: Peter Martinez

data.text: Blue Loctite. Every. Single. Time.
data.author: Peter Lehman

data.text: If you like using a torch and a breaker bar, red Loctite is for you
data.author: Matt Hankes

data.text: Medium strength on most threaded parts. Watch out for colour, I have seen blue with high strength. That stuff needs to be heated to come loose.
data.author: Curtis Evans

data.text: I always put mine together with Loctite Blue.
data.author: Eric Knudstrup

data.text: Blue Loctite
data.author: Jeff Stone

data.text: Superglue
data.author: Paul Stannett

data.text: Loctite blue is my way to go.
